Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight.

A sample of a monatomic ideal gas is sealed in a container with a movable piston. The container is thermally conducting and held in a water bath, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The gas is initially in State <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, as shown in the <math alttext="P V" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mi>V</mi></math> diagram in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> </math>. An external force <math alttext="vector F sub external" overflow="scroll"><msub><mover accent="true"><mi>F</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mtext>ext</mtext></msub></math> then causes the piston to move very slowly until the gas reaches State <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The gas is then brought to State <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and finally back to State <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math>.

(b) Derive an expression for <math alttext="Q sub 23" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>23</mn></msub></math>, the amount of energy transferred by heating or cooling during Process <math alttext="2 to 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Express your answer in terms of <math alttext="P sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="V sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, and physical constants, as appropriate.

(c) Sketch processes <math alttext=" 1 to 2" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></math> and <math alttext=" 2 to 3" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></math> on the pressure-temperature diagram in Figure <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>. State <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is indicated in the diagram. Label State <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> and State <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>.

(d) If during Process <math alttext=" 1 to 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></math> the piston was pushed quickly, instead of very slowly, and underwent an adiabatic compression until the pressure reached <math alttext=" 4 P sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at a new State <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, indicate how the line or curve for Process <math alttext=" 1 to 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></math> would be different, if at all, in the <math alttext=" P T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi><mi>T</mi></math> diagram in Figure <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>? Briefly justify your answer.
